title: The Three Little Pigs and {{childName}}: A Building Adventure

scenes.text:
Oh my, oh my!
What a day for {{childName}} to play!
Time to build and time to learn,
Up the hill now, off we turn!

Mama Pig gives the biggest hug:
"Go build your house, my little bug!
Penny, Benny, Bella too
They're all waiting there for you!"

{{childName}} bounces, bounces high,
Building houses in the sky!
Well, not really in the sky,
But it's fun to dream and fun to try!

Up the hill goes {{childName}}
Bounce, bounce, bounce!
Here's a bear with a great big smile
And tools that really count!

"Hello, {{childName}}!" calls Builder Burt.
"Welcome to my favorite place!
Building things is so much fun
Let's start our day with a happy face!"

Three big piles sit in the sun:
Golden straw that sparkles bright,
Brown sticks standing straight and tall,
Red bricks strong with all their might!

"Every builder picks what's right,
Every choice is good and true.
Take your time, look all around
What feels perfect, {{childName}}, for you?"

"{{childName}}! {{childName}}! {{childName}}!"
Three voices call so sweet!
Here come the pig siblings,
Dancing up the street!

Penny bounces up and down:
"Quick-quick-quick is how I play!
Build it fast with golden straw,
Then we'll laugh the day away!"

Benny carries sticks with care:
"Not too fast, not too slow,
Right between is where I like
That's the way I like to go!"

Bella holds her bricks up high:
"Slow and steady wins the race,
Brick by brick and nice and strong,
Everything in its right place!"

All three siblings gather 'round
With excitement in their eyes:
"Which way feels just right for you?
What will be your building surprise?"

{{childName}} looks at the straw so bright,
{{childName}} looks at the bricks so tight.
Quick or careful? Fast or slow?
Which way should our {{childName}} go?

Penny sings her happy song:
"Fast is fun and never wrong!
Build it quick and then we'll play
That's my favorite kind of day!"

Bella hums her gentle tune:
"Careful work will be done soon.
Strong and steady, built with care
Love and patience everywhere!"

Builder Burt nods with a smile:
"Both are good and both worthwhile!
Listen close to your own heart
That's the very best place to start!"

Ready, {{childName}}? Here we go!
Fast or careful, what do you know?

choices.label: Let's build fast and go play!

scenes.text:
"Fast-fast-fast!" calls {{childName}} loud.
Penny bounces, feeling proud:
"Straw is light and straw is fun!
We'll be done before the sun!"

Stack, stack, stack the golden straw!
Pat, pat, pat without a flaw!
Builder Burt brings armload more:
"Learning's what building is for!"

Up goes the house, quick as can be
{{childName}} builds it happily!
Soft and cozy, light and bright,
Done already? What a sight!

"Hooray, hooray!" both piggies cheer.
"Fast building brings us joy and cheer!
Look what {{childName}} built today
Now it's time to run and play!"

Just as {{childName}} starts to play,
Someone's walking down the way.
Rustle, rustle in the trees
"Oh my goodness, who is he?"

Out steps Walter, looking sad,
Trying not to feel too bad:
"Hello, pigs, I'm Walter Wolf.
I'm confused about myself."

"I'm supposed to huff and puff,
But that never works enough.
Houses fall, and no one's glad
It just makes me feel so bad."

When Walter huffs at the straw house
Whoosh! It scatters like a mouse!
But Walter doesn't look mean,
He's the saddest wolf I've seen!

"Oh, I'm sorry!" Walter cries.
"I just want to fit in, but I...
All I know is huff and puff,
And that's never good enough!"

Now what should {{childName}} do?
Help everyone, or think it through?

choices.label: Let me think of something new!

scenes.text:
"Careful-careful!" says {{childName}} wise.
Bella smiles with happy eyes:
"Bricks are heavy, bricks are strong!
We'll take our time and sing this song!"

Lift and place and check it's right,
Lift and place from morn to night.
Builder Burt shows how it's done:
"Patient work can be such fun!"

Brick by brick, the house grows tall,
Straight and strong, it will not fall.
{{childName}} learns with every stone
How to build a loving home.

"Well done, well done!" the siblings say.
"What a house you built today!
Strong and safe from roof to floor
What could anyone want more?"

{{childName}} admires the house so neat
When footsteps come down the street.
Rustle-bustle, who could it be?
"Oh!" says {{childName}}, "Come and see!"

Walter Wolf steps into sight,
Looking tired, not wanting to fight:
"Hello, everyone, I'm here,
But I don't want to cause you fear."

"I'm supposed to huff and blow,
But that makes everyone feel low.
I just want a cozy place,
And friends with a smiling face."

Huff-puff at the straw it flies!
Huff-puff at the sticks surprise!
But the brick house stands up strong,
Walter's confused what went wrong.

"I don't understand!" he sighs.
"Huffing makes everyone cry.
I just want to learn something new
Could someone like me belong too?"

{{childName}} has built the strongest house,
But quiet they sit, as a little mouse,
What's the kindest thing to do?
Help them all, or teach them too?

choices.label: Come inside my house so strong!
Let me teach you right from wrong!

scenes.text:
"Together-together!" {{childName}} calls,
"We can fix whatever falls!
Walter, don't be sad or blue
There's a place here just for you!"

"Really-really?" Walter asks,
"Could I help with building tasks?
All I know is how to blow,
But I'd love to help you grow!"

{{childName}} thinks and gets an idea:
"Your huffing could help us clear!
Blow away the old debris,
Help our building spirits free!"

Penny bounces: "What great fun!
Working together, everyone!"
Benny nods: "A building team
Makes the best of every dream!"

Builder Burt claps with delight:
"{{childName}}, you make everything right!
Leading friends to work as one
That's how great things get done!"

The Super Team works all day long,
Building houses, singing songs!
{{childName}} leads with happy cheer,
Making sure that all feel dear.

Hammer-hammer, stack-stack-stack!
Walter's huffing helps us pack
Old stuff away and new stuff dry
"I can help!" he says with a sigh!

Penny zips and Benny plans,
Bella teaches with gentle hands,
Every house gets strong and new,
Built with love from me and you!

"This is wonderful!" Walter beams,
"Better than my wildest dreams!
My huffing helps instead of harms
{{childName}} welcomed me with open arms!"

Soon the village looks so bright,
Every house a happy sight.
{{childName}} smiles with pride so true:
"The best building has me and you!"

"Think-think-think," says {{childName}} bright,
"I can make this problem right!
Building fast taught me so much,
Now I'll add the special touch!"

Stack the straw but add some sticks,
Use all the building tricks!
Bella's wisdom, Benny's way,
Plus my speed to save the day!

Builder Burt nods with a grin:
"Smart thinking always wins!
Learning how to blend and mix
Makes the very strongest fix!"

Walter watches, eyes so wide:
"{{childName}}'s thinking with such pride!
How did you learn to combine
All those ways to make them shine?"

Up goes a house that's something new
Fast and strong and lovely too!
"I learned that quick can also be
Smart as smart as smart can be!"

{{childName}}'s new house stands so proud,
Drawing quite a happy crowd!
But looking at poor Walter's face,
{{childName}} thinks of a helping place.

"Walter, Walter, don't be sad,
Your huffing isn't really bad!
What if we could find a way
To make your talent help all day?"

Walter perks up, hope in sight:
"Could my huffing be just right
For something good instead of wrong?
Could I finally belong?"

{{childName}} gets excited-cited-cited:
"Your breath could get us all delighted!
Windmills powered by your puff,
Paint dried gently that's not rough!"

"Really?" Walter starts to glow,
"My huffing could help things grow?
{{childName}}, you're so smart and kind
To help me use my heart and mind!"

Both friends think of ways to share
Talents that show they really care!

"Come in, come in!" {{childName}} calls,
"My house has very sturdy walls!
Room for everyone inside,
Safe and cozy, warm with pride!"

In they hurry, in they go,
Safe from Walter's wind and blow.
"Thank you, {{childName}}!" the siblings cheer,
"Your house keeps us safe from fear!"

Walter stands outside alone,
Wishing for a friendly home:
"May I come in your house too?
I promise to be good and true!"

"Of course!" says {{childName}} with care,
"There's always room for friends to share!
My strong house was built for all
Who need help when troubles call!"

Safe inside, they sit and discuss,
Cozy and warm, the room a-buzz.
{{childName}} looks around and sees
Everyone's happy, as can be.

Sitting safe in {{childName}}'s strong place,
Everyone shares with loving grace.
Walter's not scary, just feeling blue,
Needing friends who are kind and true.

"I never had a real home,
Always wandering, always alone.
I don't even know what I like to do
Besides huffing that makes folks blue."

{{childName}} thinks with heart so wise:
"Walter, you've got a sweet surprise!
Your huffing could be something good
If we help you like we should!"

"A community!" {{childName}} declares,
"Where everyone helps and everyone cares!
Walter, you could have a place
With your own important space!"

"Really?" Walter's eyes grow bright,
"Could I belong and be just right?
{{childName}}, you make me feel so glad
To know I don't have to be sad!"

Planning together, hearts so warm,
Safe from any kind of storm!

"Teach-teach-teach!" says {{childName}} proud,
"Let's share knowledge with this crowd!
Building secrets I have learned
Should be freely shared and earned!"

"Really-really?" siblings say,
"You'll teach us the building way?
Show us how to make things strong
And help us sing the building song?"

{{childName}} opens up the door:
"Come and learn building lore!
Bella taught me, now I'll share
Building wisdom everywhere!"

Penny learns to slow down some,
Benny learns that patience comes.
Soon they both build strong and neat
Teaching makes learning so sweet!

Walter watches from outside:
"Learning fills me up with pride!
Could someone like me ever learn
To build and grow and take my turn?"

The Little Building School is here!
{{childName}} teaches with such cheer!
Penny learns to build strong-fast,
Benny's houses always last!

"You're the best teacher!" Penny sings,
"Look at all the joy learning brings!"
"I love building more each day!"
Benny says in his thoughtful way.

Bella gives a hug so tight:
"{{childName}}, you make everything bright!
Teaching others what you know
Helps the whole wide world to grow!"

Walter creeps up, shy but true:
"Excuse me, could I learn from you?
I only know how to huff and blow,
But I'd love to learn and grow!"

{{childName}} looks with teacher eyes,
Seeing potential as a prize.
"Every student can learn well
What a wonderful story to tell!"

The Super Team has built so well,
What a happy tale to tell!
{{childName}} led everyone
Till the building work was done!

Walter wears his helper badge,
Standing proud upon the ridge:
"My huffing helps instead of harms
{{childName}} welcomed me with open arms!"

"Together-together!" Penny cheers,
"Building joy throughout the years!"
"Balance-balance!" Benny sings,
"See what working together brings!"

Builder Burt claps: "Hip hooray!
{{childName}} saved the day!
Not with bricks or sticks or straw,
But with the kindest heart I saw!"

And so our {{childName}} learned to see
That building's best when we are free
To work together, hand in hand
The strongest houses fill the land!

Huff and puff and blow no more!
Now Walter helps with building chore!
And {{childName}} leads with love so true
Building dreams for me and you!

Teacher {{childName}} stands so proud,
Drawing quite a learning crowd!
Walter says with hope so bright:
"Could you teach me to build right?"

"Yes-yes-yes!" {{childName}} replies,
"Everyone can win the prize!
Show me your gentle puff so sweet
That's a skill that can't be beat!"

Walter puffs so soft, so light,
Clearing sawdust left and right!
"You're already building, friend!
On my teaching you can depend!"

Soon the Building School is known
Throughout the forest, fully grown!
{{childName}} teaches big and small
There's room for learning, one and all!

And so our {{childName}} learned that day
The very best and wisest way
To use the knowledge in your heart
Is sharing it that's the finest art!

Huff and puff? Now Walter knows
How to help a building grow!
And {{childName}} teaches, kind and true
Building wisdom, me and you!

{{childName}} and Walter think
Of ways to make their friendship link.
"Your huffing is a gift!" they say,
"Let's find the most creative way!"

Walter becomes Wind Engineer,
The first and only one round here!
His breath powers the lifting wheel,
Making building work feel real!

"I love my job!" Walter sings,
"Look at all the help it brings!"
{{childName}} invented something new
A way for talents to shine through!

Builder Burt presents the prize:
"Creative thinking!" he replies.
"{{childName}} saw what others missed
Every talent should be kissed!"

And so our {{childName}} learned to find
The creative, open mind
That sees problems as a chance
To give every gift a dance!

Huff and puff now helps us build!
Walter's heart is truly thrilled!
And {{childName}} innovates so true
Building creativity, me and you!

{{childName}}'s house kept everyone safe,
No one sad, each with a place!
"Let's build homes for everyone!
A neighborhood second to none!"

Walter claps with joy so bright:
"Could I really live here right
Next to friends who care for me?
What a wonderful family!"

Walter the Protector is his new name,
Now he's playing the neighborhood game!
His gentle puffs help gardens grow,
His care makes friendship's flowers show!

Builder Burt designs with care
A place where all can live and share:
"{{childName}} built with heart so true
A home for me, a home for you!"

And so our {{childName}} learned to build
Not just houses, but hearts filled
With love and care for everyone
The strongest community under the sun!

Huff and puff now tends the flowers!
Walter helps through all the hours!
And {{childName}} builds with love so true
Building community, me and you!

childName.description: The fourth little pig sibling, eager and curious, learning through choices and growing in confidence
childName.voice: Enthusiastic, questioning, celebratory with age-appropriate excitement
childName.illustration_prompt: Full body illustration of a small, bright pink pig character with large curious eyes and cheerful round snout, wearing blue overalls and a small tool belt. Standing in alert, eager posture with slight forward lean showing readiness for adventure. Sandra Boynton art style with bold simple shapes, friendly rounded features, and vibrant colors.

Penny.description: First pig sibling, energetic and fast, loves quick building and immediate action
Penny.voice: Quick, bouncy speech with repetitive words like 'quick-quick-quick' and 'fun-fun-fun'
Penny.illustration_prompt: Full body illustration of a medium-sized bright yellow pig with sparkly energetic eyes, wearing an orange t-shirt and sneakers. Standing in bouncy pose with one hoof raised, showing constant motion and enthusiasm. Slightly messy appearance with wide excited smile. Sandra Boynton art style with dynamic, energetic posture and vivid colors.

Benny.description: Second pig sibling, thoughtful and balanced, finds middle-ground solutions
Benny.voice: Thoughtful, reasonable speech with 'hmm' and balanced suggestions
Benny.illustration_prompt: Full body illustration of a medium-sized warm brown pig with intelligent, kind eyes, wearing a green plaid shirt and sturdy work boots. Standing in balanced, steady posture with contemplative expression showing thoughtful, reasonable nature. Sandra Boynton art style with solid, dependable appearance and earthy colors.

Bella.description: Third pig sibling, patient and wise, loves careful, quality building
Bella.voice: Gentle, flowing speech with longer sentences showing patience and wisdom
Bella.illustration_prompt: Full body illustration of a slightly larger reddish-pink pig with gentle, wise features and warm patient eyes, wearing a cozy purple cardigan. Standing in graceful, dignified posture with serene expression showing caring teacher nature. Optional small glasses for wise appearance. Sandra Boynton art style with maternal, welcoming design.

Walter Wolf.description: Confused, lonely wolf who learns to use his huffing and puffing talents helpfully
Walter Wolf.voice: Vulnerable, confused speech with 'oh my' and 'oh dear', growing more confident and grateful
Walter Wolf.illustration_prompt: Full body illustration of a medium-sized friendly gray wolf with soft features and large expressive eyes showing vulnerability rather than menace. Slightly scruffy fur and initially uncertain posture that shows confusion but hope. Sandra Boynton art style with gentle, approachable wolf design that's clearly friendly rather than threatening.

Mama Pig.description: Loving mother pig who encourages independence and celebrates her children's growth
Mama Pig.voice: Warm, blessing-style speech with endearments and encouraging send-offs
Mama Pig.illustration_prompt: Full body illustration of a larger, maternal pink pig with kind loving features and gentle smile, wearing a floral apron over a comfortable dress. Standing in nurturing, open-armed posture showing warmth and reliability. Sandra Boynton art style with round, welcoming maternal design and soft, comforting colors.

Builder Burt.description: Helpful bear construction worker who provides materials and building wisdom
Builder Burt.voice: Enthusiastic, supportive speech with construction metaphors and encouraging language
Builder Burt.illustration_prompt: Full body illustration of a large, friendly brown bear with gentle features, wearing a yellow hard hat, brown leather tool belt with building tools, and blue work shirt. Standing in confident, helpful pose with big enthusiastic smile. Sandra Boynton art style with sturdy, reliable appearance and cheerful work-focused design.
